bug.author: apc999
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: v2.0.0
module alluxio-shaded-hadoop should not be published to maven repo. During process, this module should be skipped, so the version of this module () will not be hard-coded and bumped, preventing the bug like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/9416>#9416</denchmark-link>
To Reproduce Expected behavior Urgency High
See bug report <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Alluxio/alluxio/issues/9416>#9416</denchmark-link> . A quick fix has been merged but this ticket is looking for a clean solution

comments.comment: In the alluxio/shaded/hadoop/pom.xml, we already have the maven-deploy-plugin which configures that the alluxio-shaded-hadoop will be skipped during deployment. When we publish release. we use maven release plugin: <denchmark-code>mvn release:prepare // alluxio-shaded-hadoop will not be skippped. ${ufs.hadoop.version} will be resolved to 2.2.0 (should be changed back manually after release) mvn release:perform //alluxio-shaded-hadoop will be skipped so it will not be published to the maven main repo. </denchmark-code>
